      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Properties> allRowsDie(String sql, List<String> arr)
      Prepare and execute an SQL query and retrieve all the rows as an array While this might seem like a bad idea, the coding style for Tsugi is to make every query a paged query with a limited number of records to be retrieved to in most cases, it is quite reasonable to retrieve 10-30 rows into an array.

      • insertDie

        public Long insertDie(String sql,
                      List<String> arr)
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Prepare and execute an INSERT primary key query and return the new primary key.
        Specified by:
        insertDie in interface Database
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        Long This is the new primary key of the inserted row if the insert was successful. If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.

      • rowDie

        public Properties rowDie(String sql,
                         List<String> arr)
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Prepare and execute an SQL query and retrieve a single row.
        Specified by:
        rowDie in interface Database
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        Properties This is either the row that was returned or null if no row was returned. If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.

      • allRowsDie

        public List<Properties> allRowsDie(String sql,
                                   List<String> arr)
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Prepare and execute an SQL query and retrieve all the rows as an array While this might seem like a bad idea, the coding style for Tsugi is to make every query a paged query with a limited number of records to be retrieved to in most cases, it is quite reasonable to retrieve 10-30 rows into an array. If code wants to stream the results of a query, they should do their own query and loop through the rows in their own code.
        Specified by:
        allRowsDie in interface Database
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        List This is either the rows that was returned or null if no rows were returned. If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.
